intro: Cynoglossum montanum var. maroccanum, commonly known as the Moroccan ironweed, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Morocco. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy addition to rock gardens or alpine settings. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its showy inflorescences and its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
